securitygame

Class Defender

  • java.lang.Object
    • securitygame.Defender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WhatDoesThisButtonDoDefender

    public class Defender
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Defender agent. The actions for the defender in this game include strengthening nodes, adding firewalls, and adding honeypots. All logic/equations/formulas/etc for how your defender decides to select actions should be included in run()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Defender

        public Defender(java.lang.String agentName,
        java.lang.String graphFile)
        Constructor. Parses Network stored in graphFile. Performs Defender logic to select actions. Outputs [agentName]-[graphFile].defense with selected actions
        Parameters:
        agentName - Defender agent's name i.e. "Miners"
        graphFile - String containing number of network i.e. "1914"

    • Method Detail

      • strengthen

        public void strengthen(int id)
        Defender selects to strengthen a node by 1 sv. Only works on non-public nodes that are not already at maximum strength (20). Recommend using isValidStrengthen() in DefenderHelper before committing to this action
        Parameters:
        id - Node's ID number

      • firewall

        public void firewall(int id1,
            int id2)
        Defender selects to remove the edge between two nodes (firewalling them). Only works when doing so would not create island nodes and if there actually is an edge between them. Recommend using isValidFirewall() in DefenderHelper before committing to this action.
        Parameters:
        id1 - ID number of first node
        id2 - ID number of second node

      • honeypot

        public void honeypot(int sv,
            int pv,
            int[] newNeighbors)
        Defender selects to add a honeypot and gets to pick the Security Value, Point Value, and neighboring connected nodes. Attacker will not get the Point Value for this node after a successful attack. Security Value cannot be 0 (reserved for public nodes) and not greater than 20 (maximum). Points cannot be more than 20. Cannot connect to nodes not in graph. Recommend using isValidHoneypot() in DefenderHelper before committing to this action.
        Parameters:
        sv - Desired Security Value should be > 0 and <= 20
        pv - Desired Point Value should be >= 0 and <= 20
        newNeighbors - array of Node IDs to connect this honeypot to.

      • run

        Add your decision logic here in your subclass
